titlePart.text: TEXTILES AND FLEXIBLE MATERIALS NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR

noteParagraph.text: The groups in this sub-class designating sewing apparatus or machines also include sewing processes dependent on their use, and the thread seams produced thereby.

titlePart.text: General types of sewing apparatus or machines without mechanism for lateral movement of the needle or the work or both
Combined or alternative chain-stitch and lock-stitch seams
Pseudo-lock-stitch seams in which the thread loops do not positively interlock
Seams for protecting or securing edges
combined with joining or securing seams

titlePart.entryReference: sewing machines for concurrently making thread and welded seams

titlePart.text: Special-purpose or automatic sewing apparatus or machines

Sewing apparatus or machines with mechanism for lateral movement of the needle or the work or both for making ornamental pattern seams, for sewing buttonholes, for reinforcing openings, or for fastening articles, e.g. buttons, by sewing
titlePart.entryReference: with automatic control to obtain particular configuration of seams
labelling fabrics otherwise than by sewing
labels and securing means therefor, in general

titlePart.text: Article-, e.g. button-, feed mechanisms therefor
formed by general-purpose sewing machines modified by attachments, e.g. by detachable devices
Sewing machines for temporarily connecting articles, e.g. pairs of socks
Linking machines, e.g. for joining knitted fabrics
Machines for sewing quilts or mattresses
titlePart.entryReference: control of workpiece-holding frames, or of sewing machines, in order to obtain particular seam configuration

titlePart.text: for closing filled bags or sacks
titlePart.entryReference: combined with bag- or sack-filling apparatus

titlePart.text: Sewing machines for concurrently making thread and welded seams
Sewing machines with programme-controlled sequence of operations

Sewing machines with devices for automatically controlling movement of work-carrier relative to stitch-forming mechanism in order to obtain particular configuration of seam, e.g. programme-controlled for sewing collars, for attaching pockets
Sewing apparatus or machines not otherwise provided for
Sewing units consisting of combinations of several sewing machines
titlePart.entryReference: feeding or delivering thin materials to or from machines

titlePart.text: Sewing-machine elements for feeding, positionning, handling, or treating the work
with feed dogs having horizontal and vertical movements
arranged above and below the workpieces
with means for setting length of stitch
Pressers in machines for sewing leather
Workpiece holders or hold-downs in machines for sewing leather
Devices incorporated in sewing machines for supplying or removing the work
and connected, for synchronous operation, with the work-feeding devices of the sewing machine
Work-feeding or -handling elements not otherwise provided for
for attaching bands, ribbons, strips, or tapes or for binding
for ruching, gathering, casing, or filling lace, ribbons, or bindings
Indicators for positioning work, e.g. with graduated scales
Devices incorporated in sewing machines for slitting, grooving, or cutting

titlePart.entryReference: for automatically controlling movement of work-carrier to obtain particular configuration of seam

titlePart.text: Sewing-machine elements for supplying, handling, or treating thread material
Spool-pin assemblies incorporated in sewing machines
Applications of measuring devices for determining the length of threads used in sewing machines
titlePart.entryReference: measuring devices in embroidery machines , in general
application of tension indicators in handling thin or filamentary material

titlePart.text: Take-up devices, e.g. levers, for the needle thread
Devices for fastening needles to needle bars
Needle bars for multiple-needle sewing machines
with provision for varying the distance between the needles
with provision for disengaging individual needle bars
for chain-stitch sewing machines, e.g. oscillating
with bobbin casings guided in tracks
with bobbin casings held by removable caps
with bobbin casings held by magnetic forces
with spool-size bobbin for lower thread
with lower-thread packages mounted for controlled sliding movements
Applications of bobbins for storing the lower thread
Indicating or control devices associated therewith
Devices for determining or indicating the length of thread still on the bobbin
Devices associated with the loop-taker thread, e.g. for tensioning
Devices for severing the needle or lower thread
and for disposing of the severed thread end
Devices incorporated in sewing machines for lubricating, waxing, or colouring the threads
Driving-gear, control, lubricating, or cooling devices for sewing machines
Devices for changing speed or for reversing direction of rotation
Control devices responsive to the number of stitches made
Devices for stopping drive when sewing tools have reached a predetermined position
titlePart.entryReference: electric motor control systems in general

titlePart.text: Applications of devices for indicating or ascertaining sewing-tool position
with automatic means to reduce speed of drive, e.g. in one or more steps
Applications of servo devices for tool-positioning purposes
Devices for stopping drive when abnormal conditions occur, e.g. thread breakage
titlePart.entryReference: in handling thin or filamentary material in general , e.g.

titlePart.text: Casings, supports, covers, or accessories for sewing machines
Sewing machines combined with auxiliary devices serving purposes other than sewing
Devices for converting free-arm sewing machines into flat-bed machines
Frames, stands, tables, or other furniture adapted to carry sewing machines
Arrangements, e.g. hinges, for mounting sewing-machine casings to frames, stands, or tables
Covers, or portable enclosures, for sewing machines
Incorporations or adaptations of lighting equipment
Sewing machines incorporating devices serving purposes other than sewing, e.g. for blowing air, for grinding
Guards or like devices for preventing injury to operator
with mechanical means for moving thread through needle eye
with optical devices to assist threading
Tools, implements, or accessories for hand sewing
strengthened by auxiliary elements, e.g. rivets, staples
Preparatory or finishing operations in connection with hand sewing
Flattening, pounding, or pressing stitched seams
Hand sewing processes or apparatus for special work or not otherwise provided for
using apparatus with latch or bearded needles
for attaching patches or like small pieces of fabric
